response.original_title: Texas Enterprise Guide: Fixing Norton "Error 8506, 421" and Kernel Memory Conflicts
response.overview: Texas Norton Helpline: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: Texas users on high-end workstations are seeing Error 8506, 421. Technically, this is a Non-Paged Pool Memory Leak. Nortonâ€™s real-time behavioral engine attempts to allocate a memory buffer that is already occupied by a conflicting hardware driver (often associated with 2026 GPU firmware). When the memory allocation fails, the Norton service crashes, triggering the 8506 code and leaving the system vulnerable. Advanced Restoration Protocols: Kernel Pool Audit: Use the poolmon utility to identify if a third-party driver is hogging the memory required by Norton. Clean Boot Diagnostic: Disable all non-Microsoft startup services to isolate the driver conflict. Norton AutoFix Reset: Trigger the internal Norton AutoFix tool to re-align the service dependencies in the Windows Service Manager.
response.tagline: Texas Enterprise Guide: Fixing Norton "Error 8506, 421" and Kernel Memory Conflicts
response.title: Texas Enterprise Guide: Fixing Norton "Error 8506, 421" and Kernel Memory Conflicts
